reviewText:
Mitos.is is a game in which you play a cell, consuming other, near-identical, cells. However, it itself is a straight-up clone of another, near-identical game, Agar.io.

It is in this mindless consumption of your faceless equals that the game reflects not only itself and Freakinware, but every other attempt at cloning Agar.io. It consumes and absorbs everything Agar.io is, was, and will likely ever be, in a mindless bid to fuel it's own growth, and become the biggest fish in the pond. As it tries to devour and conquer, it is opposed by countless others vying for the exact same goal. Each as pitiless, remorseless, and fearless as itself, purely driven by the id. And yet, despite the goal of growth, no true growth or progress can ever be made. No matter how big one grows, they still continue to hunt the same objective, never satisfied, never accomplished.

As far as one may have physically grown, there is no mental development, no questions. No whys. In leaving behind their mental abilities in the pursuit of growth, they have become exactly as Freakinware are. No interest in the cultural or philsophical, no interest in becoming something more than they are. They only care about being the biggest circle on the screen. A mindless number in a sea of mindless numbers.

Mitos.is Review – Raymond K. Turcotte

I apologize in advance; it has been long overdue since my last review. I thought the review would be appropriate to strike back and return with. Now, I have played agar.io and in my opinion it is excellent. I was told of Mitos.is from a friend and told it’s not that bad and since it’s free why not.  First impression was negative. I opened the game and realized that I was displayed on the screen as Player162733 or something like that was immediately thought that I was signed off of Steam or something, but no I had to create an account for no apparent reason. Thinking over that there are some benefits, if I travel and want to play Mitos.is at a friend’s house all I have to do is sign in within the game. *no hassle.  Another thing I thought was bazar was the armour, powers, shield etc. In the game store. I had played a game of FFA and was shot with a spider web or something and I couldn’t move and an enemy ate me. Again, I was confused and wondering what the heck! It is a huge turn off for gamers when you realize you have to start from the bottom like that. There are also loads of other things that bug me about the game but I won't dive into it today. For example the whole coin thing bugs me. Unfair matchmaking makes this game frustrating for new players. It's quite stupid when an enemy can simply stun you and casually float up to eat you while you have nothing to counter with.

Anyway, my final thoughts is mixed I don’t hate the game in fact I think I’m gonna keep playing it, I just don’t like the whole concept. Remember Agar.io?… that was a good game. Wait, dose Agar.io and Mitos.is relate somehow. No, probably not. (Sarcasm)

reviewText:
Alright, now, I'm going to try to make this short. TL;DR is at the bottom.

Comparing It to Agar.io
Yes, it's an Agar.io rip-off, but it has added features. It's much more responsive, detailed, interesting, and comes with default music and sound effects. The principle of Mitos.is is exactly the same to Agar.io, but like I said, they've spiced it up a little bit.

What's Added/New to It?
Here I'll go more in-depth.

It's more responsive. A hell of a lot more. Agar.io revolves around you getting lucky whether the website would actually detect your mouses' location or not, and Mitos.is fixes that. It's so much easier to squeeze yourself out of sticky situations and catch people out.

They've kept the skins. But you have to level up to earn them. I'm not too sure what I think of that. On Agar.io, it's nice to be able to just pick your skin and boom, there you have it, and Mitos.is lacks that. But at the same time, isn't it nice to wear a skin that you've earned?

Sound Effects and Music. That's what Agar.io really, really lacked. Yes, sure, you can download mods for it and all, but why not have it there anyway without some tacky browser add-on? Lovely, isn't it?
Mitos.is' music is also 10x better than the Agar.io modded ones. Bleugh.

TL;DR ~ It's Agar.io with better graphics and motion control with ranking, leaderboards, leveling up, music and sound effects.
7/10

EDIT
Well. I have to pay to continue?
3/10.

reviewText:
Mitos.is is a nice free game in which you can hop in, play a bit, and jump back out at your leisure. Play a few minutes in between other things, or have a few hours to spend trying to get big, either way works.

The gameplay is basic, but solid. You spawn as a circle/cell and you collect little things laying around to get bigger. Once you are big enough, you can eat smaller players by running into them. Games with this premise date back litterally as long as I've been alive, and probably further back as well.
As for this one, the bigger you are, the slower. So you can avoid the bigger players while gathering your own mass, and then come back to take them out instead.
You can split yourself in two for a speed boost and control both orbs to chase down your prey, and then you can keep splitting yourself again and again if you want to. Of course, being smaller like that means there is the risk that someone bigger than you comes by and eats up part of your cell, and you'll have to keep on running to avoid them.
That said, you can use the speedboost to run as well, when things are too bleak to stand for them, yet you want to not lose it all, leaving behind part of your collected mass may be preferable to losing it all.
There are also virus nodes, and eating those will burst you into smaller chunks. You can use this by throwing a part of your mass through these and then onto your opponent, thus giving you an easier snack.

Mitos.is comes with multiple game modes, including free for all, teams, CTF, and guild based modes. One thing I initially disliked was that FFA servers included people teaming up at times, but after a few more times playing I ended up realising how good this actually was for the tactics available in the game.

Once you're large, you may attract someone else who is a lot smaller. Sure, you could throw a whole lot of your mass over at him, eat his tiny amount of mass, and be vulnerable to bigger blobs coming to get you...Or you could not. Just let him stay around near you, buzzing around you and growing bigger in safety as you scare away (Or eat) anything that preys on the little guy. Then in turn, when someone bigger than you comes by, the small guy you've been protecting may throw his own mass at you to allow you to overcome the threat.
And if you then throw back some to your new friend, both of you profit. I'm fairly sure this is how the first monkey-like creatures decided to start living together, and it works. Teaming up can arise organically, and there is nothing wrong with that. Just advanced survival tactics

Mitos.is is a simple but good game, it's easy to pick up, easy to put down, and varied enough to keep you playing it and coming back occasionally. It's small size and price of 'free' makes it hard to justify not giving it a try, but do not expect too much, it's not some deep masterpiece or complicated puzzle, it's just something nice for you to enjoy until you grow tired of it

reviewText:
Mitos.is: The Game, (I will call it Mitos.is), Is a free-to-play, 2D, massively multiplayer, indie game VERY similar to Agar.io. The game is bassically Agar.io, but different, with it's own achivements, a whole lot more skins, and power-ups.

Mitos.is has much more than 3 game modes. In fact, it has 6 different game modes. My personal favorite is Free-For-All. The game also features a level system, where the bigger you are, the higher place you are, and the longer you last, get you more EXP. Levels show other online players how skilled you are, and let you purchase more items/power-ups. Items in the game will help you in different ways. To get these items, you need coins, which you get from doing the daily rewards, collecting them around the map, and getting achivements. Achivements in-game act as a purpose to playing the game, so to speak. And, last but not least, there multiple different skins to choose from, and you make your own skin, with the right amount of coins, that is.

Overall, this is a great game, and I really do recommend it. You will get more steam hours, and it is A LOT easier to play with friends and family, than playing Agar.io.

reviewText:
This game is great, yes it is Agar.io, but that's what it is meant to be, Agar.io on steam. There are lots of gamemodes and skins to choose from, the gamemodes get really creative, like Hunger Games, soccer and much more, or you can just stick to plain old Free for All.
Yes, there are stat bonuses, but they are very small, some people say the game is bad because of the stat bonuses, but I don't mind, you're  the one who is supposed to decide about that.
Making your profile is fast, no email confirmation or things like that, you just type your username, confirm your password, and you are done.
People who say the game is very laggy, you can change the server like US East, Russia and other things like that in the options.
Its Agar.io with more gamemodes, more skins, and you can play with your best friends.
And negative reviews, yes, I know you can go to agar.io on your browser, but you can't play with friends, and there aren't as many gamemodes as this one. I also know that it is a clone of Agar.io with more features, yes, we all know, do you think the game developers made the game, thinking that people will think its an original idea? No, of course not! They just wanted a game like Agar.io on steam. Yes, most of the reviews are old and say paywall everywhere, but they removed the paywalls and added in-game currency, the in-game currency is only for skins, EXTREMELY small stat bonuses and making private rooms to play with your friends alone.
Coins are obtainable by getting chests and opening them for free, collecting coins while playing, and doing missions.
(Yes, I know there are extremely small stat bonuses that cost in-game money. But I don't really mind about that, other people do, but I don't know if you care about EXTREMELY small stat bonuses for in-game money.)

reviewText:
PROS:
+ 8 different modes - my favorites ones are Random Team and Territory War.
+ Leveling system that it's simple but gives you some more motivation to play.
+ Casual but not too much: you can definitely see a lot of difference in skill between a lvl 20 player and a lvl 50 one.
+ Free: in game coins are easy to earn, you absolutely don't need to spend real money.
+ Not too hard for newbies: they just introduced separate servers in FFA mode - for beginners (lvl 1-19) and for experienced players (19-69).
+ Fun to play with friends (it's also easy to add new friends met in-game and chat with them).
+ Nice graphics and music.
+ Low system requirements.
+ Keeps improving.

CONS:
- Well, everyone knows it... Agar.io ripoff.
- Basic gameplay.
- Repetitive.
- Bugs (see below).

Examples of bugs:
You join a mode, but instead the game makes you join another mode.
One of your three daily missions wants you to do a certain thing, but the game sometimes fails to recognize that you did that thing.
After the last updates, it seems to me that when you're small-medium sized, it's harder to eat the small cells: you split and your cell just pass through the smaller cell of your foe, without eating it.

6.5 / 10

reviewText:
Wondering which game is better, Agar.io or Mitos.is? Easy answer when you look at the content of each game!
Here are some obvious pros and cons about both games.
(mobile version of both games have its own set of pros and cons so I will not go into detail about them)

If you don't want to read all of that then here is my opinion and review of the game:
Mitos.is is a great game that has a variety of gamemodes and activities to keep you entertained. I believe it is more immersive than Agar.io with the varied music and sounds that fit quite well with the game. Please read the Pros and Cons of both games below to understand why.

Also, I do know about the whole controversy about Mitos.is being a rip off of Agar.io. I do not know when either game was released. I do know that Mitos.is started on mobile and then recently got on Steam, and Agar.io started on the web browser and then recently got on mobile at about the same time as the other expanded into different platforms.

The main reason why Mitos.is is being called a rip off is because the skins are the same as Agar.io's skins. Also Agar.io got much more attention because Youtube stars such as Markiplier and JackSepticEye played it, leaving Mitos.is (which was only on mobile at the time) in the shadows. Play both games and develope your own opinion and comment them below if you can.

Agar.io Pros and Cons:
Pros-
1. can be played on any computer that uses the internet.
2. quick jump in the action play and no account authorization needed.
3. You can connect your Facebook to it for some bonuses that can help you survive longer.
4. has a few gamemodes for variety.
5. has free skins you can use for your cell by typing in a specific name.
Cons-
1. no music and sounds. Sure you could play your own music in the background with another program, but I like to have some type of sound when you gobble up players and dots!
2. no sense of progression after hitting the top 3 on leader multiple times (or just getting on it multiple times).
3. can become tedious and repetitive after a couple hours or more of play time.
4. for use of a skin you must type in a specific name and many other players are most likely using the same name and skin.
5. has many of the same skins Mitos.is has and vise versa.

Mitos.is Pros and Cons:
Pros-
1. has music and sounds. The music is great and not too repetitive.
2. has an option to set up an account for level progression.
3. level progression that unlocks items that can be bought with coins (which are earned, but can be bought with micro-transactions).
4. coins are not a too difficult to accumulate and can be found in all gamemodes. also has acheivements and challenges that grant you more coins.
5. has multiple gamemodes for a ridicalous amount of variety.
6. has a guild thing and guild war gamemode.
7. you can have your own personalized skin for your cell.
8. has a chat system so you can rage or laugh at your opponents (and teammates) using text (it does have a filter for you protective parents to not worry).
9. if you made an account with Mitos.is, it can be linked with mobile version and Steam version.
Cons-
1. cannot be played on any computer. You need a Steam account to play unless you play mobile version.
2. has many of the same skins as Agar.io and vise versa.
3. skins are bought using coins and making your own can cost around 200 coins.
4. personalized skins must be cleared for use by the Mitos.is team which can take as long as 4 days (which is understandable why it is like that).

Hey, you read the entire thing? Great job!.....Or did you just scroll all the way to the bottom?

reviewText:
Wondering which game is better, Agar.io or Mitos.is? Easy answer when you look at the content of each game!
Here are some obvious pros and cons about both games.
(mobile version of both games have its own set of pros and cons so I will not go into detail about them)

If you don't want to read all of that then here is my opinion and review of the game:
Mitos.is is a great game that has a variety of gamemodes and activities to keep you entertained. I believe it is more immersive than Agar.io with the varied music and sounds that fit quite well with the game. Please read the Pros and Cons of both games below to understand why.

Also, I do know about the whole controversy about Mitos.is being a rip off of Agar.io. I do not know when either game was released. I do know that Mitos.is started on mobile and then recently got on Steam, and Agar.io started on the web browser and then recently got on mobile at about the same time as the other expanded into different platforms.

The main reason why Mitos.is is being called a rip off is because the skins are the same as Agar.io's skins. Also Agar.io got much more attention because Youtube stars such as Markiplier and JackSepticEye played it, leaving Mitos.is (which was only on mobile at the time) in the shadows. Play both games and develope your own opinion and comment them below if you can.

Agar.io Pros and Cons:
Pros-
1. can be played on any computer that uses the internet.
2. quick jump in the action play and no account authorization needed.
3. You can connect your Facebook to it for some bonuses that can help you survive longer.
4. has a few gamemodes for variety.
5. has free skins you can use for your cell by typing in a specific name.
Cons-
1. no music and sounds. Sure you could play your own music in the background with another program, but I like to have some type of sound when you gobble up players and dots!
2. no sense of progression after hitting the top 3 on leader multiple times (or just getting on it multiple times).
3. can become tedious and repetitive after a couple hours or more of play time.
4. for use of a skin you must type in a specific name and many other players are most likely using the same name and skin.
5. has many of the same skins Mitos.is has and vise versa.

Mitos.is Pros and Cons:
Pros-
1. has music and sounds. The music is great and not too repetitive.
2. has an option to set up an account for level progression.
3. level progression that unlocks items that can be bought with coins (which are earned, but can be bought with micro-transactions).
4. coins are not a too difficult to accumulate and can be found in all gamemodes. also has acheivements and challenges that grant you more coins.
5. has multiple gamemodes for a ridicalous amount of variety.
6. has a guild thing and guild war gamemode.
7. you can have your own personalized skin for your cell.
8. has a chat system so you can rage or laugh at your opponents (and teammates) using text (it does have a filter for you protective parents to not worry).
9. if you made an account with Mitos.is, it can be linked with mobile version and Steam version.
Cons-
1. cannot be played on any computer. You need a Steam account to play unless you play mobile version.
2. has many of the same skins as Agar.io and vise versa.
3. skins are bought using coins and making your own can cost around 200 coins.
4. personalized skins must be cleared for use by the Mitos.is team which can take as long as 4 days (which is understandable why it is like that).

reviewText:
I've been playing agar.io quite a lot, I'm pretty good at it, and I like it. So when I first heard of Mitos.is, I was rather annoyed because of the obvious plagiarism.

Well, I'm not annoyed anymore. Mitos.is took a fun concept, copied it, expanded it, and made a standalone game. Mitos.is' devs aren't in for the quick and easy money. They're obviously putting a lot of effort and thought into the agar.io concept. And Mitos.is turned out to be the game I was hoping for when I discovered agar.io.

Don't get me wrong - agar.io is still great, but it's limited. It's a fun, little game with quite some depth. Mitos.is made the little game a big game. Over the time, agar.io has been developed very conservatively, with small new features being implemented at a slow pace, and always careful that it still stayed agar.io. Mitos.is, on the other hand, expanded the game as progressively as you could imagine, and it turned out to work just great.

And while, as stated, I do like both games, there is one thing that Mitos.is does better than agar.io: The endgame. Or, more specifically: the implementation of an endgame. agar.io always lacked it, and frankly, in the standard modes, Mitos.is does as well. It's just part of the concept. You get bigger and bigger, and then what? The thrilling phase is getting to the top3, then it becomes rather boring. With game modes like Zombies, CTF, Hunger Games and Terrain, Mitos.is gives you the opportunity to play limited rounds that you can win.

All in all: Mitos.is turned out to be great! And it's free, couldn't detect any p2w function.

So I tried this out because having a locally-saved alternative to Agar.io that doesnt require me to log into Facebook to use would be nice, but overall I was super disappointed by it and will be continuing to use Agar.io for all my cannibalistic blob needs.

There's a simple map that helps point out where level boundaries are, or in some of the other gamemodes things like allies and objectives appear and it becomes a lot easier to navigate because of it.
Mitos.is is a LOT more ambitious with its gamemodes. When I played it there were like 5 or so? Your standard modes from Agar.io like Free-for-all and Team, but also things like Humans vs Zombies, Capture the Flag, and Soccer.
